Title__c: BQA-10391 Zim Timecards automate for projects
BMCServiceDesk__shortDescription__c:
There is need to automate the timecard approval process from Zim to Twix with hours for projects. 

There is one team who log their time on Zim for projects. Currently they are manually entered on Twix. 

They need to pushed automatically from Zim to
BMCServiceDesk__incidentDescription__c:
There is need to automate the timecard approval process from Zim to Twix with hours for projects. 

There is one team who log their time on Zim for projects. Currently they are manually entered on Twix. 

They need to pushed automatically from Zim to Twix to IFS similar to WorkOrders that Scott’s team does.

Below are the steps that need to accomplished - 

1.. Send project, subproject data to Zim - already in place

2.. Zim need to be modified to accommodate the changes and provide users with the feature to select the required data(activity, resource etc) while logging time

3.. Zim integration code need to be modified to capture all the additional data related to projects during timecard process approval from zim to twix.

4.. Test the entire process of timecard approval from Zim → Twix → IFS ->Dayforce

Title__c: BQA-10403 Utilize the CHARGES tab to properly account for TAX on FULL Price of discounted Purchase
BMCServiceDesk__shortDescription__c:
ORIGINAL SHORT DESCRIPTION: Need the ability to utilize the charges tab on a Purchase Order Tool Room Purchases and Fabrication purchases

Need to elevate to P2. 

Need to modify the CRM for "Forward Supplier invoice" to include any line items that ma
BMCServiceDesk__incidentDescription__c:
ORIGINAL SHORT DESCRIPTION: Need the ability to utilize the charges tab on a Purchase Order Tool Room Purchases and Fabrication purchases

Need to elevate to P2. 

Need to modify the CRM for "Forward Supplier invoice" to include any line items that may be included on the charges tab... This will allow us the use to account for promo purchases & other fabrication purchases.... 
The current work around is not allowing AP to process invoices with PO's that have a PROMO purchase, as we have to add a non-taxable line item to add the cost of the tax that we are required to pay for the Promotional item.  Too many line items on the PO and the AP cannot match the lines on their inovices. 

Notes From Discussion between Business & Hoist: 

Debbie Fink provided breakdown below - 

Wanted to share my notes from this meeting:
• Jishu walked through the suggested process
• Brandon pointed out that this process is unfortunately flawed since the 2nd line accounting for the TAX is NOT taxable and will NOT book correctly on the GL side
• It could be a decent SHORT-TERM work-around
• Alan gave his thoughts - absolute no go because of how Taxes are (not) accounted for using this method, too much risk of tax authority "double" charging for taxes on these transactions (when audited) since they are not clearly visible on the Tax ledger
• REAL solution should be to use the Charges tab - works PERFECTLY for this and many other scenarios, and is MUCH easier
• Brandon is sticking to the explanation that "we cannot use the Charges tab since the FSI function does NOT include the Charges tab"
• Is it possible to ADJUST the "Legence Forward Supplier Invoice" CRIM to INCLUDE the Charges Tab (BQA-5871: CRIM - Auto-forward Supplier Invoices to projects [BQA-8577 Scenario #2]
CLOSED
)????
• Debbie will read through JIRA and supporting documentation
• Will forward any thoughts, questions, concerns to Brandon and Dave for their discussion with the business
Original Caller: Brandon Routley
Original Incident: INC34236577

Title__c: CRIM - MATTR-GH2023-01Shawcor Handheld Code Uplift
BMCServiceDesk__shortDescription__c:
*   The attached code needs to be uplifted to execute on APPS10.
  *   Please use the HOIST Apps10Dev instance to perform uplift.
  *   See attached spec for more details on changes required. Basically anything that is preventing the code form compiling
BMCServiceDesk__incidentDescription__c:
*   The attached code needs to be uplifted to execute on APPS10.
  *   Please use the HOIST Apps10Dev instance to perform uplift.
  *   See attached spec for more details on changes required. Basically anything that is preventing the code form compiling will be due to IFS Changing APIs between APPS8 and APPS10, and will need to be uplifted.
  *   The code should be deployed to a new schema (already created in Apps10DEV) called ‘FLEX1APP’. Password to login to FLEX1APP is also FLEX1APP.
  *   The API calls will need to be modified to reference the appowner “ifsapp” for testing, and then “SHAW1APP” for final delivery.
  *   So for instance a call to CLIENT_SYS in one of the packages would need to be “IFSAPP.CLIENT_SYS”, as the code will be living in “FLEX1APP” schema.
  *   Only change what is required to get the code running.
  *   No API parameters  or return types can be changed, as the client code cannot be altered.
  *   Required sequences, tables are located in the attached PLSQL.zip.


gavin.hall@hoist.tech

  *   The API calls will need to be modified to reference the appowner “ifsapp” for testing, and then “SHAW1APP” for final delivery.
  *   So for instance a call to CLIENT_SYS in one of the packages would need to be “IFSAPP.CLIENT_SYS”, as the code will be living in “FLEX1APP” schema.
  *   Only change what is required to get the code running.
  *   No API parameters  or return types can be changed, as the client code cannot be altered.

2. MATTR CRIM GH2023-01.docx
******************************


  • The attached code needs to be uplifted to execute on APPS10.
  • Please use the HOIST Apps10Dev instance to perform uplift.
  • See attached spec for more details on changes required. Basically anything that is preventing the code form compiling will be due to IFS Changing APIs between APPS8 and APPS10, and will need to be uplifted.
  • The code should be deployed to a new schema (already created in Apps10DEV) called ‘FLEX1APP’. Password to login to FLEX1APP is also FLEX1APP.
  • The API calls will need to be modified to reference the appowner “ifsapp” for testing, and then “SHAW1APP” for final delivery.
  • So for instance a call to CLIENT_SYS in one of the packages would need to be “IFSAPP.CLIENT_SYS”, as the code will be living in “FLEX1APP” schema.
  • Only change what is required to get the code running.
  • No API parameters  or return types can be changed, as the client code cannot be altered.
  • Required sequences, tables are located in the attached PLSQL.zip.

BQA-10313 CRIM - Add WO # and Status fields to Work Task Sales and Work Task Transactions
BMCServiceDesk__shortDescription__c:
Business Requirements Overview

This will tremendously benefit our working process for Fab jobs in terms of operational efficiency.

If we have these fields added, during billing we can search the work order with the status from the work task transact
BMCServiceDesk__incidentDescription__c:
Business Requirements Overview

This will tremendously benefit our working process for Fab jobs in terms of operational efficiency.

If we have these fields added, during billing we can search the work order with the status from the work task transactions and start our billing process. Once we are done we can either set the work task to “Reported” or “Finished” this way it will not affect Scott’s group to apply more cost to the work order level. Once the work order is truly done, it will be much easier for Scott to go in from the Work Order to finish all his jobs.

Title__c: BQA-10328 Suppliers with Multiple Remit to Addresses
BMCServiceDesk__shortDescription__c:
Description

There are going to be instances where Suppliers have multiple Remit to Addresses in IFS such as Grainger and Home Depot because they have multiple locations.

Once a PO is created with a Supplier, it cannot be changed, and AP cannot choos
BMCServiceDesk__incidentDescription__c:
Description

There are going to be instances where Suppliers have multiple Remit to Addresses in IFS such as Grainger and Home Depot because they have multiple locations.

Once a PO is created with a Supplier, it cannot be changed, and AP cannot choose a different Supplier at the time of Invoice entry.  The PO would need to be UN-received and cancelled and a new PO created. Therefore, it is imperative that the person entering the PO chooses the correct supplier. 

If there are multiple Suppliers and only one is valid, the others can be “turned off” and not useable by entering a date into the “Expiration Date” field in the Purchase section/General tab.

Users will not have access to the Suppliers area in IFS to be able to determine which Supplier number to use based on the remit to address. 

What do other companies that use IFS that have Suppliers with multiple Remit to Addresses do in this instance to eliminate selecting the wrong Supplier? We cannot have users asking us every day which Supplier they need to choose if there are multiple options with different addresses. You cannot tell at the time of PO creation what the address is of the Supplier until you process the PO. By this time, it is too late.
